title: mac OS ， Cannot start normally and exit
body:

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
[Please be as specific as possible]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
normal startup
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Cannot start normally and exit

**Frequency:** [How regularly does it occur?]

every time

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [teku/v22.9.0/osx-x86_64/oracle-java-11]
* Java version: 
 java version  "11.0.9" 2020-10-20 LTS
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.9+7-LTS)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.9+7-LTS, mixed mode)

* OS:uname:Darwin 19.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 19.2.0: Sat Nov  9 03:47:04 PST 2019; root:xnu-6153.61.1~20/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
rlimit: STACK 8192k, CORE 0k, NPROC 1392, NOFILE 10240, AS infinity, DATA infinity, FSIZE infinity
load average:2.36 2.17 2.11

CPU:total 4 (initial active 4) (2 cores per cpu, 2 threads per core) family 6 model 69 stepping 1, cmov, cx8, fxsr, mmx, sse, sse2, sse3, ssse3, sse4.1, sse4.2, popcnt, avx, avx2, aes, clmul, erms, lzcnt, ht, tsc, tscinvbit, bmi1, bmi2, fma

Memory: 4k page, physical 8388608k(656416k free)

vm_info: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (11.0.9+7-LTS) for bsd-amd64 JRE (11.0.9+7-LTS), built on Sep 15 2020 15:57:40 by "mach5one" with gcc 4.2.1 Compatible Apple LLVM 10.0.0 (clang-1000.11.45.5)

Is that the entire output you get when running teku? It seems to be just the debug info after a JVM crash that lists the running threads but doesn't include the actual reason for the crash which is what we need to be able to help.

It also seems that you are running on a system with 8gb of RAM, so I think you shouldn't give more than 3GB to the JVM.
Refer to: https://docs.teku.consensys.net/en/latest/HowTo/Get-Started/Manage-Memory/
Going to close this one as we don't have a full error to go on.  Please feel free to reopen if you can provide the requested information.
